definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: I prefer to use debit card when shop on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 我通常喜歡用提款卡在網上購物。

sentences.english: You need to build a business, not to make new friends on-line.
sentences.chinese: 你需要建立一個生意，不結交新朋在網上。

sentences.english: And he has discovered many such grass-roots experts on douban. com.
sentences.chinese: 而且他在豆瓣網上已經找到了許多這樣的草根專家。

sentences.english: In terms of the syllabus, it's going to be online.
sentences.chinese: 至於教學大綱，網上會有。

sentences.english: "Electronics are a lot easier to compare online, " Robertson said.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯特森認爲，“網上更容易比較電子產品的價格。
瀏覽網上自由譯者佈告欄。

sentences.english: Webcast of the take-off and landing will go live 5 minutes prior to each event.
sentences.chinese: 網上直播的起飛和降落會活5分鐘前，每個事件。
考慮一下在網上租電影吧。

sentences.english: On-line order and signup for online trial.
sentences.chinese: 網上訂單和註冊爲在線試用。

sentences.english: I found this on the web.
Trade on the net, most those who make a person afraid is con.
sentences.chinese: 網上交易，最讓人擔心的是欺詐。

sentences.english: Will you ever be able to make money on general-interest news on the Internet?
sentences.chinese: 你能從網上的新聞中賺到錢嗎？

sentences.english: Online education gives students enough flexibility.
sentences.chinese: 網上教育使學生們獲得了許多靈活性。

sentences.english: Welcome to the Hong Kong Diploma of Secondary Education (HKDSE) Examination Online Services.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎使用香港中學文憑考試網上服務。

sentences.english: Instead, they watch pirated DVDs or surf the Web.
sentences.chinese: 取而代之，他們看盜版光碟或者在網上衝浪。

sentences.english: Guru. com - The world's largest online marketplace for freelance talent.
sentences.chinese: 世界上最大的網上市場，爲自由職業人才。

definition: to go online/to connect to the Internet/(of a document etc) to be uploaded to the Internet/(tennis, volleyball etc) to move in close to the net
network (computer, telecom)/Internet/Taiwanese term for 網絡|网络[wang3 luo4]
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to have sth to do with/to relate to/related to/to concern/concerning
to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
